description.message: Reload an unpacked extension with one click, hotkey or automatically.

background_tab_manifest_3_msg_text.message: This is the background tab. This tab is required for Advanced Extension Reloader to function correctly, don't close it.

ports_help_text.message: Ports separated by commas that should expect messages to reload extensions. You will need multiple ports if you develop multiple extensions.

click_action_help_text_chrome.message:
An object that defines what happens when you click on the browser action icon or hit "Reload extension main" hotkey specified at chrome://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Whether to reload the extension as opposed to just reloading the current page. If set to false, the background page will not reload. The manifest.json will not reload even if this option is true, unless you use listen(); function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" package in the background script of the target extension. Can be combined with "all_tabs".

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Whether to reload all tabs as opposed to just reloading the current tab.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
An id of an extension to reload in "hard" mode. If unspecified, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_sound: boolean
default: false
Whether to play notification sound upon reload completion.

full_reload_timeout: number
default: 300
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a confirmation that an extension has started reloading using browser.runtime.reload();. Advanced Extension Reloader will try to reload an extension with browser.runtime.reload(); only if you use listen(); function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" package in the background script of the extension. If no confirmation is received, or you don't use listen(); function the extension will be reloaded using browser.management.setEnabled(id, false); browser.management.setEnabled(id, true);.

This value will also delay the reloading of the extension when you click reload button (browser action), so if this value is 1000, you will need to wait 2000 milliseconds until reload completes.

Example:

{
    "all_tabs": false,
    "hard": true,
    "ext_id": "ffhljpfecjcfjdaneehmhdgplkaafnbb",
    "play_sound": true,
    "full_reload_timeout": 1000
}

click_action_help_text_edge.message:
An object that defines what happens when you click on the browser action icon or hit "Reload extension main" hotkey specified at edge://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Whether to reload the extension as opposed to just reloading the current page. If set to false, the background page will not reload. The manifest.json will not reload even if this option is true, unless you use listen(); function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" package in the background script of the target extension. Can be combined with "all_tabs".

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Whether to reload all tabs as opposed to just reloading the current tab.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
An id of an extension to reload in "hard" mode. If unspecified, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_sound: boolean
default: false
Whether to play notification sound upon reload completion.

full_reload_timeout: number
default: 300
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a confirmation that an extension has started reloading using browser.runtime.reload();. Advanced Extension Reloader will try to reload an extension with browser.runtime.reload(); only if you use listen(); function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" package in the background script of the extension. If no confirmation is received, or you don't use listen(); function the extension will be reloaded using browser.management.setEnabled(id, false); browser.management.setEnabled(id, true);.

This value will also delay the reloading of the extension when you click reload button (browser action), so if this value is 1000, you will need to wait 2000 milliseconds until reload completes.

Example:

{
    "all_tabs": false,
    "hard": true,
    "ext_id": "ffhljpfecjcfjdaneehmhdgplkaafnbb",
    "play_sound": true,
    "full_reload_timeout": 1000
}

context_menu_actions_help_text.message: An array of objects with the same schema as seen in "Extension's icon click action" that define additional reload actions that appear in the browser action context menu. Keep in mind that there is a limit on how many items can appear there. You can also use reload actions defined here by hitting one of the "Reload extension X" hotkeys, where X is a position in the array.

open_background_tab_automatically_help_t.message: Always keep one background tab open, reopening it if it's closed.

open_position_in_tab_strip_label_text.message: Open position in the tab strip
